text: Bottle from Bridgend Services, Freuchie. Pours a very dark brown. Thin, off-white head that just about clings to the side as we go. Aroma has a powerful pine hit. Dank tropicality. Stone fruit aroma. Red berry jammy notes. Caramelised orange. Toasty aromas. Very light coffee and chocolate. Very well played. Taste has more red berry notes, both fresh and dried. Seville orange tang. A little citric and juicy lemon. Substantial bitterness. Long, bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel. Light roastiness at the end. Decent carbonation. Medium to full mouthfeel. Bench-marking gear here. Lovely!

These are daft beers, arent they. Confusion at the outset as the cola / stout appearance yields to a piney, citrussy fruit salad. Then, if not done well, its a horrible clash of coffee and fruit. When done well, like here, the hops are fruity and dank and the roasted malt and chocolate provide a subtle backbone. Good body too.

On tap at the Buxton Brewery taproom on 26-May-2017. Almost black with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt and cocao nibs. Full body and medium carbonation. Taste of malt, chocolate, molasses and hops. A lovely smooth bitter hoppy chocolatey finish. Pretty good Black IPA.

Fairly opaque with a light head and good lacing. Low body and fairly carbonated. Outside of yer customary IPA hoppiness youve got some bitter black coffee flacors thrown in, a bit piney, a bit smokey. A solid refreshing BIPA but definitely not on a level of its own
On tap @ Hanging Bat Edinburgh. Mild malty aroma and tastes of smoke, cigarettes, and saltine crackers. Somewhat watery for a black IPA.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of roast malt and dark chocolate with some fruity hops. Moderate sweet and bitter. Oily with medium body. Very nice.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, citrus. Taste is fairly rich bitter, citrus followed by coffee in the finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Solidne ciemne IIPA.

Bottle from Hanging Bat. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - wafts of canned oranges and apples on opening. A general expansion into fruit salad by the time the pour has finished. On closer inspection add some resin and molasses. 
Taste - more fruit salad intermingled with molasses, dark chocolate and toffee. Marmalade. Lime taper on the finish. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - great stuff. A very narrow style to get right but this was nailed. First 4 of 2017.

dark brown colour, moderate sized beige-ish head; aroma of cocoa powder, overripe tropical fruits, grapefruit, pine resins and grape seed; taste of dark chocolate, overripe tropical fruity sweetness, grapefruit, grassy and resiny notes and grape seed bitterness; great black IPA!

It was a good, but a quite yeasty stout and I didnt think much of it. Then I realised that it was well past its drink by date, which explains a lot. No taste of hops, some good dark malts, a bit of alcohol, but too much yeast.
Аромат после отстоя пены. Кофе, карамел& Приемле& но плотнос& для "темног эля" мало.

Olmost black with a light brownb head - Malt and fruity hop aroma - Malt body to support a good hoppy flavour that is fruity with good bitterness - the hops with bitterness goes into the finish - This was good

Bottle 33cl. poured into a shaker. Clear dark ruby brown, good frothy tan head, fairly lasting, good lacing; fruity nose, aroma dark malts, oranges, cherries, black berries, after a while also cocoa, light licorice; taste medium sweet and bitter, roasted malts, dark chocolate, dried dark fruits; lingering roasty sweetbitter aftertaste, chocolate, fruity; medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation; very good.

Black colored, medium creamy tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is of dark chocolate, roasted malt, moderate citrus and pine hops. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, chocolate and cocoa, roasted malt, moderate citrusy grapefruit and floral hoppiness, medium bitterness, dry finish, lasting roasty bitter aftertaste. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
(bottle, Sir Williams Pub, Ljubljana)

On tap in Kaschk, Berlin-- Pours deep black with thin tan head. Nose is caramel and roasted malts. Aromas are roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits, licorice. Average carbonation, full body. Long sweet, roasty and fruity finish. Really complex and great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 Donkerzwart bier met crèmekleurige schuimkraag die goed aan het glas blijft plakken. Heerlijk aroma en smaken van drop, zoethout, citrus, appelsien, beetje koffie. Lekker volle romige smaak met een mooi zoet-bittertje op het eind. Lang leve Buxton.

Keg at The Earl Grey Inn, Leek. A deep brown colour with a medium off white head. Aroma of toasted malts, milk chocolate, dark fruits, slight honeycomb, a little grapefruit and subtle burnt toast. Taste of toffee, toasted malts, some milk chocolate, grapefruit, slight orange, a hint of melon, a little dark fruits and subtle burnt toast. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A long, toasted malt bitterness in the finish with a syrupy fruit aftertaste. A complex BIPA with more flavours from the black side than the IPA side but overall, so well made and I enjoyed it. Dangerous too.

0,5 l on tap at Sir Williams Pub. Pours dark brown with thick tan head. A lot going on in the nose, milk, chocolate, roasted malt, some molasses, plenty of tropical fruit and citrus, some pine and general fruity notes, pears and peaches. Taste is a nice balance of sweet and bitter on top of fruitiness mixed with roasty noes, coffee and chocolate. Slick palate, average carbonation and a nice long hoppy bitter finish. Nicely balanced and drinkable BIPA.

0.33l bottle. Black body, light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, lemongrass, grapefruit and grass. Taste of chocolate, caramel, grapeseed, pineapple and grapefruit. The finish has a quite intense hop bitterness. Medium bodied with a lower than average carbonation. Very nice BIPA!

33cl bottle. Dark brown pour with a tall tan head with OK retention. Notes of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, pine resin, dank cellar, bitter hops. Medium body, high carbonation and roasty and hoppy-bitter finish.

Theres a nice balance of alcohol, hops and malt at the beginning, with notes of grapefruit, pine, honey, toast and coffee, but the taste of burned toast gradually grows stronger and stronger until its the overwhelming aftertaste. Starts well, finishes a little too strong.
On keg at Ushers bar. Pours opaque black. Nose of chocolate, malts, toffee, nz hops. Taste is biscuity, malty, bit of fruit, bourbon biscuits.
Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pitch black, beige head. Chocolate, lots of roasted coffee. Great flavours, bitterness from the roasted malts is good. Supernice.

Light hop aroma for IPA. Aroma gets a bit malty. Heavy roasting and low carbonation. Description on the back of the bottle doesnt give a matching sensory account of its content in my humble opinion. In short heavy roasting and average bitterness with some shy hops.

Appearance is black, opaque, a 2-finger cream head which quickly settles. Aroma- citrus fruit, orange, pineapple, malts, hint of milky coffee. Taste- lots of chocolatey malt running through, toasty malt, chewy toffee, bitter fruity hops, caramel, coffee, a bit more chocolate. Bitter and slightly chewy mouthfeel. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Buxton Brewery by Imperial BlackRami Rami is drinking an Imperial Black by Buxton Brewery at Powiśle20 dni od rozlewu. aromaty zywiczno-cytrusowo-zbozowe glownie. W ustach iglakowe, wytrawne, spora goryczka. Calosc bardzo intensywna.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2016 Holiday, top-50 fun hunt. #-6. Pours very dark brown to black with a nice fine light brown head. Aroma of laurel, hop, licorice, roasted malts. Taste quity some laurel, pine, hops, above average bitterness, dry, hoppy, resinous, nice however not great,

sample from bottle, poured a deep brown colour with a tanned head. nose of ripe fruits, citrus, bitter hops, caramel sweetness, light coffee, slight dry cacao, liqorice, sweet raisins. quite bitter finish, long lasting bitter aftertaste. quite balanced
Black like a rotten banana riding a bicycle. nice citrusy hops go well together with the full bodied malt. Fabulous.

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium copper head. Nose is on dark malt, hop resin, mint and licorice. Aroma is on resin, pine, caramel, licorice, zest, high bitterness, mint touch, light chocolate, more hopy than malty.

Bottle 0.33l from Saveur Biere beer webshop. Hazy dark brown color, average beige head. Smell of pine, herbs, fruits, alcohol. Full body, medium to heavy carbonation. Too carbonated. Too strong bitterness in taste, overpowering everything else. Pine in taste with caramel and fruits. I love black ipa but this one isnt something I enjoy.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Very dark brown color, average sized tan head. Aroma of fresh hops, citrus, herbs, roasted malt, caramel. Taste of hops, roasted malt, citrus, oranges, herbs, pine. Surprising level of bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Couleur noire, forte mousse beige. Nez fort houblonné pin et note cremeuse café. Gout houblonné, fruits exotiques, litchis avec palais malt, café et forte amertume grillée et pin. Fin de bouche forte amere zeste agrumes .
330ml bottle. Roasted malts and fruity hoppiness in the aroma. Taste is moderately bitter, medium body, some carbonation. Very solid but pretty straightforward black IPA.

33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Thin beige persistent head. Taste is medium to high bitter. Finish is super long and medium dry. Very balanced body and taste. Aroma is grass, hops, roasted, fruity.

33cl bottle at home from FirmaBier. Nose citric and roasty. Body is pitch black, head is small, off-white, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is citrus, milk chocolate, grapefruit, parfume. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light citric sour. Finish is medium lasting hoppy slightly roasty medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, slick texture, average carbonation. Quite easy, perfect balance, not a brutal BIPA, nice one.

0,33l bottle at home. Bottled 08.02.2016. BB 08.11.2016. black color, small tan head. smells of grapefruit, exotic fruit, resin, licorice, earthy. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of licorice, resin, grassy, light exotic fruits, grapefruity. finishes lightly bitter with notes of licorice and resin. quite nice one, drinks good could be a bit more refreshing.

Black liquid. Medium beige froth. Citrussses, apricot, roasted malts, hints of plums in the aroma. Citrussy beginning. Apricots, hints of cocoa and coffee in the middle. Citrussy bitter finish. Really nice, well balanced, classical black IPA.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a small tan head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. A lot of bitterness with subtle fruity tones. Hops, caramel, malts, pine, anise and spices. Very good BIPA.

Aroma: citrus, sulphur. Appearance: black, clear, tan foam, rocky head, lasts quite long. Taste: light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness. Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, aftertaste a bit astringent, lasting bitterness.
Svart hvor noe lys slipper gjennom i kantene. Frukt, Bær og lakris i duften. Søt lakris, grapefrukt og overmodne røde Bær i smaken. God bitterhet og tykk munnfølelse.

Wow. First smell is lemon, apricot, peach and raspberry. The promise of hops comes back on the first sip. Hoppy fruits all over but then there's also light roasted malts and sweet fruits.
Flavors shift from light acidic to light sweet with bitterness present all the time. None of the flavors is overpowering, balance is good.
Mouthfeel is medium and creamy. I love it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 0,33l fles gedeeld met bryan, zwart met een crème kraag. Geur is mooie balans van de mouten, cacao chocolade en karamel. Hop blijft iets op de achtergrond. Smaak gaat verder in dezelfde lijn maar richting de afdronk komt er iets herbal hop bij. mooi romig mondgevoel met een volle droppige afdronk. Real nice
Bottle, 330 ml from Luvians Bottle Shop, St. Andrews. Pours dark brown with beige head. Roasted malts, hops, fruit, hint of chocolate. Bitter finish.
Aroma of malt, hops and some hay/grass. Taste is hops, malt, coffee, licorice. Well balanced and a very nice black ipa. Glad i had this one!
Pours pitch black, wounderful aroma of citrus, orange, apricot, licorice and cedar. Taste is smooth, some chocolate, coffee, ends with a long hoppy bitterness. Overall a really well brewed black IPA.

Kolor : Czarny z rubinowymi refleksami . Nieklarowny. 
Piana: Bardzo ładna. Drobno oczkowa. Trwała , beżowa. Długo się utrzymuje. Fajnie brudzi teku. 
Zapach : Imperium kontratakuje! Atak jest potężny. Zewsząd atakują cytrusowe i tropikalne aromaty. Starcie mango , ananasa i grejpfruta . Tuż za nimi w szeregu maszerują owoce leśne : borówki i jerzyny oraz soczyste maliny. W drugiej lini frontu nadchodzą żywiczne nutki które uderzają swoimi sosnowymi igiełkami niczym ostrymi bagnetami.
Nos powoli poddaje się i ulega ich woni. 
Smak: Pełny. Wyraźny. Szereg owocowych nut. Tropiki i cytrusy uzbrojone w konkretną , nieściągającą goryczkę. Delikatny smak palonych słodów. Idealny balans! 
Wysycenie : Średnio-niskie. 
Podsumowanie: 

Piwo jest kompleksowe. Pełnia smaków i aromatów chmielowych.
Goryczka świetnie zbalansowana. Słodowa baza wyraźna i świeża. Alkohol jest perfekcyjnie ukryty. 
Buxton po raz kolejny udowania jest kultowym angielskim browarem, który trzyma stały poziom swoich piw . Czapki z głów!
Nie ma co dodawać - trzeba dopić do końca i oblizać się po ostatniej kropelce ;p

Black body, big fluffy head. Strong citrusy aroma, pine and exotic fruits, light toasted malt notes. Flavours citrus, pine, exotic fruits, caramel, all blending amorgniously. Whao. Long bitter fresh finish that ends up dry. Great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with some brown shining through near some light and a lasting creamy head. Smells of fresh tropical fruit and molasses with a hint of chocolate. Tastes great. This is far closer to an IPA with hints of dark malt than any sort of balance. yet the bitterness isnt overpowering and each sip feels new. Tastes of tropical fruit with a hint of a mild in the back. Nice.
From a bottle. The cocoa after-taste once the hop bitterness dies back is delicious. Great stuff.

Bottle @ Man in the Moon. Black with a big creamy thick head. Hoppy and rosted aroma, citrus, coffee and grassy notes. Light smooth mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Hoppy citrus taste with rosted malt, chocolate and lemon zest.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Opaque very dark brown with a medium beige to dirty white head. Nose is milk chocolate, roasted malt, hints of liquorice and molasses, tropical fruit, citrus fruits, pine. Taste is grapefruit, roasted malt, liquorice, slight Marmite, pine, hints of chocolate. Its quite bitter, with both salty yeast extract, roasted malt, pine lingering with some dryness on the finish. Its strong, bold, but ultimately not a beer style that quite works for me.

Bottle, thanks to Ben! Pours clear black, light creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, citrus, pine, grapefruit. Flavor is light plus sweet, light plus bitter, pine, citrus, slight roastyness, coffee. Medium body.

Totalmente negra, espuma bege de média retenção e formação. Aroma lupulado torrado, leve café e dulçor, intenso. Paladar segue as impressões do aroma, com dulçor um pouco mais presente, prazerosa. Corpo médio, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste torrado, chocolate amargo, amargor decrescente. Muito boa.

From a 330ml bottle on 1/10/2015. Pours close to black with a smallish head. Has a quite powerful aroma featuring fruity hops and some dark malts. Take a sip and you are immediately taken by wonderful bitter sweet contrast, with a cacophony of flavour, including roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, tropical and stone fruit. This is sweet, very hoppy and oh so delicious. The palate is slick and the carbonation soft. Definitely amongst the best black IPAs Ive tried. A wonderful brew.

Very dark brown color with light brown head. Very hoppy nose with tons of citrus notes under pinned by roasted malts. Medium full body, tons of cotton candy, citrus notes with excellent roasted malt character. Sharp malt and hop character. Lingering roasted malt finish. Excellent example of the style, but doesnt make top three for me.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Schiuma marroncina molto abbondante, colore nero con riflessi rossi.
Profumo molto intenso, buonissimo, di frutta tropicale, agrumato, erbaceo.
Sapore tostato, dolce di malto appena percepibile prima dellavvento del grande amaro, agrumato, lunghissimo nel finale, anche tostato. In bocca oleosa, facile da bere nonostante la gradazione e lintensità dei sapori. Somiglia molto alla Black Hop Sun della Granda. Una bomba.

Nez: Malt rôti, pin, agrumes
Bouche: Crémeuse, malt rôti, pin, pamplemousse, fruits de la passion
Une amertume douce en fin de bouche accompagnée dun léger grillé et dune sécheresse
Une bière excellente

Joli noir crémeux ... Nez très expressif. Attaque acide & amère. Bel équilibre général. Cest rarement mauvais chez Buxton. Une vraie belle réussite daccord entre les arômes torréfiés et la fraîcheur du houblon. Une bière accueillante, pas prétentieuse, qui nen fait pas des tonnes dans des prix acceptable. Vraiment bien donc.

Black, not totally opaque, thick creamy head. Very fruity hops, roasted aromas are very subtle, strong malts. Tastes almost like a pale fruity IPA, with a bitter kick that is just rightly dosed. Good IPA.
33cl bottle @ Hell hunt. Pours black with a thick light brown head. Citrusy fruity, roasty, woody aroma. Pleasant.. Flavor has roastedness, grapefruit, licorice. Long finish. Roasty. Very good.

Een mooi zwart bier. De geur is overweldigend: hoppig, bloemig, zoetig, fruitig. De smaak is heerlijk: hoppig, bloemig, gebrande mout, caramel, fruitig. De nasmaak blijft heel lang hangen. Een heerlijke black IPA.
Bottle. Born in England, wearing American. Full bodied with a pale-tan head, intense aroma, infinite palate.

Bottle at the Hare and Billet, Blackheath. Dark brown pour with a beige head. Blackcurrant, bitter fruit and raisin aroma. Passion fruit, blackberry and roast malt flavours leading to a bitter fruit finish. Nice.

Bottle at The Hare and Billet, Blackheath, London - black coloured pour with a big puffy beige head. Aroma and taste is a mix of roasted malts and tropical fruits, some citrus, prominent hoppy, grapefruit, pine needles, some caramel, cocoa, roasted hoppy finish. Lovely.

Bottle from my summer Secret Santa. Aromas are pine, citrus, and slightly burnt wood. Tastes a little sweet at first. Light chocolate, caramel and citrus juice get overpowered by pine and deep roast. Dryish finish. High carbonation. Solid black IPA.
@ Tromvik 26/7-15. Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Roasted and hoppy with notes of citrus/grapefruit, coffee and some chocolate. Body is medium, the finish is dry, bitter and roasted.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, wysoka, trwała. Ładnie oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Owoce tropikalne (mango, marakuja, ananas), cytrusy (grejpfrut), żywica, czekolada, zboża.
SMAK: Owoce, przemieszane z cytrusami i czekoladą. Spora goryczka, zalegająca, przyjemna.

Bottle from Euston Tap. Dark brown with a huge beige head. Fresh citrus nose as well as hint of berries. just a hint of roasted malts, initial caramel sweetness giving way to fresh citrus hop bitterness. Very good.

Draught. Very deep brpwn liquid with medium light tan head. Aroma of coffee, light ash, licorice, fresh hops, citrus, mango and light toast. Taste is very light sweet and medium to high bitter with notes of coffee, fresh hops, citrus and light ash. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice.
Bours black with a thick tan head. Nose is very grass, herbal, pine. Taste is malt, pine, coffee. I love the earthy feel to it - solid bro
Shared bottle at home. Pours black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, pine needles, citrus. Taste bitter, roasted, with a little malt sweetness.

330ml bottle in Harrild & Sons, London (£5.50):
This one was a really excellent black IPA, quite possibly one of the best that Ive tried of the style to date (Im not 100% sure but it is certainly up there anyway). Juicy, flavoursome & really refreshing to drink, this one was an excellent tasting beer that went down in no time at all. After finishing the majority of the bottle I realised the beer had been bottles just over one year ago but this definitely didnt seem to have a negative impact on the taste, the beer was superb & its one Ill be hoping to pick up again now.

Draught. Pours pitch black with a foamy light beige head. Aroma of pine, grassy, biscuit, hint of chocolate. Taste is of coffee, citrus, pine, some signs of the alcohol on the finish. Smooth mouthfeel, light carbonation.

33cl in beer market. Pours black with reddish hues. Cat all over this, Meadow grass,toast, some chocolate fighting through. Roast malts, grass, chocolate, light coffee. Full luscious body. Long grassy finish. Gorgeous.

33cl dans une tulipe Duvel. Robe noir foncé avec des reflets rouges et un bon col de mousse beige bien aérée. Un arôme résineux et citronné, fruité (mûre, cassis). En bouche on perçoit tout de suite le houblon avec une touche herbeuse et rafraichissante, peut être du raisin rouge, puis un final torréfié avec du caramel et des notes de café. Belle amertume durable, mais pas envahissante. Une très bonne bière, dont on ne se lasse pas, riche et rafraichissante. Je prend toujours soin den avoir une ou deux sous le coude!

Bottle from de Molen Beershop, bottled 19/2/15 BB 19/2/16, large sample. Dark brown color, big frothy light brown head. Big aroma of piney and citrussy hop, slight roast and hint of cookie. Medium bitterness in taste, some roast, slight cookie sweetness. Slight thin in body, but the aroma makes up for that. Good beer.

Cask in the Buxton Tap House, Buxton. Pours mahogany with a really light layer of cream froth. Mild pine hop aroma. The taste is bitter with pine initially before chocolate and liquorice. Nice balance between roasted malt and hop profiles. Really good.
KØLF 141114. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, pine. Flavour is coffee, roasted malt, hop, chocolate, pine, orange, citrus. Very nice beer.

Cask at Buxton Tap House. Black with thick tan head. Heady fruity hop aromas with roasted malt... Flavours follow suit. Really thick and creamy malts with a strong hop backbone. Superb black IPA. Helps that it was served impeccably at Buxtons own tap house.

Black body, beige huge head, standing bumpy. Lacings varied with holes.
Dry prunes through forest leaves, pine cones, liquorice and berries, and a tiny coffee note into the nose. Tastes dark malts, dusty leafy hops, liquorice, coffee notes, huge bowl of dark fruits. Lingering fruity dark finish including potent hops. Bodys good, carbonations soft. Tasty sipper.

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Beige foamy head with a coffee colored liquid. Smells of Hazelnut and citrus. A complex tste of grass, citrus, coffe & punch. Sweet & bitter aftertaste. Overall an exceptional Black IPA.
330ml bottle from Eebria. Pours black with tan head. Brilliant zesty Black IPA with hints of chocolate and a nice bitter finish. Lovely.

English black IPA with dense, creamy, pale beige, regularly shaped head and opaque black colour. Strong and very attractive, elegantly spicy hoppy and refreshing aroma of grapefruit, pine needles, lemon zest, chocolate fondant, dried plums, toasted bread, black pepper corns, liquorice, dried wormwood and other bitter herbs, tangerine, walnuts, blueberries... Fruity onset, raisins, sourish berries, pear, with a strong and very refreshing citrus peel note, medium carbo, smooth and oily mouthfeel, smooth and velvety dark maltiness ensuing with nutty, caramelly and slightly chocolatey character, becoming roasted bitter in the end, but no coffee-like flavour: instead, the roasted bitterness is interrupted by the hops, playing their role in drying the mouth, with a resinous, peppery and lovely citrussy, aromatic quality as well as deeply bittering, lasting for a long time; alcohol warms a little bit, whisky-like, but does not become too apparent at any point. This is a beautifully crafted example of a style I admittedly have a weakness for. Cheers to Buxton, one of those new, creative English craft breweries. Makes me curious for the rest of their range.
Donkere roodzwarte kleur met een volle lichtbruine kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, chocolade, koffie. Smaakt bitter, koffie, fruitig, vanille. Goede bittere smaak, maar ook zacht en zoetig. Mooi bier.

(Buxton Imperial Black) Bottle 330 ml, shared with vipinvelp, ABV 7.5%
Black coloured body, light beige head, tall but a bit thin, with good retention though, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma of grass, hops, citrus, not so much roasted character.
Nice taste, grass, light hops, wild plantation, light chocolate, roasted malts now, liquorice.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Very nice.

Flaska från Savuer Biére. Smak och doft av humle, grapefrukt, svarta vinbär, rostad malt, torkad frukt med toner av choklad och tobak. Fruktig, frisk, spännande och välbalanserade smaker, lätt kropp, beska med smak av grapefrukt och tall.
Bottle at home, black beer with a medium head, aroma is roasted, some citrus. Taste is citrus, malt, some coffee, nice one

Piana beżowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, ładny lejsing. Barwa ciemno brązowa, dość mętna. Aromat intensywny, cytrusy połączone z iglakami a w głębi dojrzałe słodkie owoce tropikalne. Po ogrzaniu dochodzą akcenty ciemnych słodów. Poezja! W smaku na początku fajna czekoladowo-kandyzowana (papaja) słodycz z dodatkiem karmelu szybko skontrowana silną alkoholowo-żywiczną goryczką, dość długo utrzymującą się na kubkach smakowych. Wysycenie średnie do niskiego, pełnia średnia, lekka szorstkość w odczuciu. W afterteasie likier mango, przypalone ziarno kawy i lukrecja. Alkohol obecny, rozgrzewa, ale nie przeszkadza. 
Ciekawa interpretacja stylu Cascadian Dark Ale - przy zamkniętych oczach można by uznać, że pijemy American IPA. Akcenty kawy, kakao i palone są na bardzo niskim poziomie, intensywność cytrusów, żywicy i tropików natomiast na poziomie Imperial IPA. Nawet barwa mogłaby być ciemniejsza...
Really fresh hop aroma. Fruity and a little citrus. Really nice beer, drinkable for the above. Try it
Quite dark color, brown lasting lacing foam head. Hoppy aroma, some fruit tones. Nice bitter taste, short lasting. Thanks Douberd for sharing this. (Velp 201504)

Piana intensywna, piwo ma barwę ciemnobrunatną. 
Piękny aromat. Pierwsze narzucają się cytrusy (pomarańcza), później pojawiają się delikatnie ciemne owoce (jeżyny), po ogrzaniu natomiast zapachy tytoniowe. Tło stanowi aromat kojarzący się z syropem klonowym i słodka czekolada na granicy wyczuwalności.
Piwo jest gęste i pełne w smaku. W pierwszej chwili mamy muśnięcie słodów palonych i lekko słodkiej kawy, pokrywanej smakiem chmielu: suszony tytoń i trawa. Finisz to mocna, ale krótka goryczka, pozostawiająca posmak trochę kojarzący się z palonym słonecznikiem. Piwo jest idealnie zbalansowane.

Brilliant beer. Almost faultess. Pours black with lasting mocha head. Bags of grapefruit, orange peel on the nose, some liquorice and a light chocolate malt. Taste is a beautiful blend between refreshment and nourishment. Zesty citrus boosted by the perfect carbonation. Followed by some tobacco and chocolatey malts. Flavors are entirely derivative. But so what. When each element is so distinctive and bold it replaces the need for singularity. Awesome beer. This and Beavertowns Black Betty are world beating BIPAs.
On tap. Serious Black IPA. Fantastic appearence and fantastic aroma. I absolutly going to drink more of this.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma citrus, orange, grapefruit, pine, roasted malts, caramel. 
Taste caramel sweets, piney citrus bitters. 
Mouthfeel creamy, dry. 
Great beer!

On tap at the Buxton brewery tap house. Jet black with an off white head. Aroma is fruity and then roasted malts. The taste is slightly sweet with a big bitter finish.
How: Bottle Appearance: Black color, medium tan head. Aroma: hops, citrus, coffee, pine . Palate: medium body, low carbonation.

On draft in Madrid. Light bodied Black IPA. A bit hazy and a deep dark brown color. A little light on aroma for me, but the balance is fantastic. Carb level is perfect, and a great bitterness level that is present, but allows the malt character to come through. Great example of the style!

Dun brun très foncé, cette bière laisse un mince collet beige. Des arômes de torréfaction sentremêlent aux effluves dhoublons plutôt agrumes. En bouche, cest dabord lamertume et le malt torréfié qui sont perçus, mais sen suit rapidement les agrumes et la mangue. En finale, cest une combinaison de café, damertume et de résine. Une texture légèrement crémeuse et agréable en bouche, on a là une black IPA bien balancée!

Remember when IPAs were bronze or orange? Me neither. The pendulum has swung so far that the black tide has temporarily swept good Australian bottle shop shelves clear of traditional IPAs. This is a good bottle-conditioned English example of the style. Prodigious lacing head. Aroma of mango, passionfruit and milky coffee. Bright citrus flavours with a resinous, piney finish. Espresso notes and some alcohol burn. Phlegmy. (330ml bottle from Leura Cellars. BB 11/6/15)
Cask. Black color with beige foam. Grassy aroma of hops, even wormwood, very hoppy flavor, soft carbonation, creamy taste with powerfull bitterness. Good Black IPA.

9/I/15 - 33cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: 11/VI/15, bottled: 11/IX/14 (2015-25) Thanks to The_Osprey for the trade!
Little hazy deep brown beer, huge creamy beige head, stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Bottle conditioned. Pours a black colour with a thin beige head, the aroma is fruity, taste is light bitterness with the malt , with a dry finish.
330ml bottle bougth at Apollon platebar. Black with thick beige head. Smell of hops, grass and leather. Taste really bitter. A little bit too bitter.

Bottle from saveur-bière.com & Six Roses Bar. Limperial black est très sombre, avec un nez dagrumes et de fruits exotiques. En bouche, cest costaud, avec des notes dagrumes, de frutis exotiques et un côté résineux. Cela se boit facilement, cest une belle réussite.

Bouteille 33cl partagée avec Tderoeck, merci! 
Brune foncée, col dense et crémeux sur une couleur café au lait. Doré au verre.
Arôme sur une pointe de malt, léger chocolat, caramel et grillé, houblonné perce en rétro ajoutant une belle balance fruitée.
Palais est léger en amertume avec une impression de Cascade. Profil malt tirant vers un léger style anglais, note de Maris, cara, chocolat. Fruité rappelant les agrumes, note de pamplemousse, pour un fini râpeux et au caractère anglais. Petite note damertume perce en fin de bouche et balance la part belle des malts.
Bue à la pression. Couleur noir trouble, mousse peu épaisse et peu persistante. Grosse attaque houblonnée puis grillé café bien équilibré. Finale secte et amère, grande longueur.

Barwa i piana: barwa czarna, praktycznie nieprzejrzysta, wydaje się klarowna. Piana mocno zabarwiona (beżowa), kremowa, początkowo obfita i umiarkowanie trwała, ale ładnie oblepiająca szkło. 

Aromat: dominują nuty chmielowe (żywiczno - cytrusowe), wsparte słodką słodowością (kawa, czekolada, karmel, leciutka paloność). Niewielkie estry (wiśnie w czekoladzie) oraz ograniczona alkoholowość. Nieźle. 

Smak: wyraźna chmielowa goryczka, zrównoważona przez nuty karmelowe, kawowe i czekoladowe (gorzkie). Wyczuwalna (aczkolwiek nieprzytłaczająca) paloność z wytrawnym, lekko kwaskowym finiszem. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty. Balans doprawdy idealny. 

Goryczka i odczucie w ustach: wysoka goryczka chmielowa, wsparta dodatkowo ciemnymi słodami, ale (o dziwo) tylko trochę drażniąca i umiarkowanie długa. Średnia pełnia, niskie do umiarkowanego wysycenie i lekko szorstkie oraz kwaskowe odczucie w ustach, będące pochodną ciemnych słodów i chmielu. 

Najlepsze piwo z tego browaru, jakie miałem okazję próbować. Barwa i piana idealne. W aromacie niemal perfekcja (braknie jedynie nieco więcej chmielu), podobnie w smaku. Alkohol jest tu świetnie ukryty i gdyby nie niewielka kwaskowość byłaby maksymalna nota. Doprawdy nie spodziewałem się aż takich doznań. W połączeniu z atrakcyjna ceną można śmiało stwierdzić, że jest to najciekawsza BIPA, jaką piłem. Warto...

Pours out a stout head of thick tan foam. Settles into a thin crust of creamy malty foam.
The nose on this thing is disarming and deceptively deep and floral. Looks like a stout, smells like an IPA. Nice strong hints of ripe kiwis and passion fruit.

First mouthful is light, carbonated and hoppy. There is no syrupy heft. Something youd expect of a imperial stout or strong porter which this had every indication of being when poured out.

Only as the first few mouthfuls settles into the back of the throat does the stout experience start to kick in with a toasty, malty, barley-like bass beat. There is a soft harmony of toffee, and a hint of dark chocolate. Breathe in through your nose and let it linger in the back of your throat and you amazingly get another cheeky reminder that the brewers crafty use of aromatic hops.

Goes on my favorites list.

Bottle. Dark brown colour. Aroma of burnt caramel. Taste fisrt little sweat then smoked/burnt caramel, dark chocolate and little citrus. Heavy body. Good, but not mine style beer.
Dark brown, very small white head, no lacing, some carbonation, no blue cheese taste like I have had in previous versions, quite nice, bottle at bottle shop.
Mørkebrun/svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, sitrus, furunål og hint av sjokolade og kaffe. Smak av røstet malt, kaffe, rosin, sitrus, noe lakris og krydder. Vinmonopolet.

Deep brown body, almost black, with a light-brown head that stays finger thick (a very very small finger though) until my glass is empty. The before mentioned glass is decorated with foamy remnants when empty. Very strong aroma that is unusually hop driven for the style, with lots of tropical fruits, citrus and pine. The malty notes are far in the back. The flavour however, is much more balanced, with almost equal amounts of hops and malt. Especially the quite long aftertaste has lots of bitter coffee, but also initially and mid-palate there are a good amount of roasted notes, mainly chocolate. The hoppy part is tropical with lovely notes of orange. The taste is moderate to light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Almost full body, an amazing creamy texture and soft to moderate carbonation. Very close to the perfect BIPA! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 3 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Tvedestrand]

Pours black with a large, fluffy tanned head. Citrusy aroma with lemon juice and peel, some faint pine and roasted malts. Taste is very well balanced but with a decent, floral bitterness. Moderate roasty notes and maltiness blends well for a dry finish, and a lasting mellow bitterness. Feels creamy on the palate, medium-light bodied with close to high levels of co2. Very nice!
Almost pitch black with foamy beige head. Aromas of roasted coffee and citrus. Fairly oily mouthfeel. Long finish. Good, but not quite Buxtons best.

Pitch black colour, slim beige head. Coffee dominates the nose, a nuanced hoppy undertone too. Taste is quite hoppy and roasted: coffee, chocolate, citrus and red fruits and caramel. Nicely bitter. Bodys a bit watery, creamy and soft mouthfeel and low carbonation.

Bottle at home. The colour is pitch black and has a small, creamy, beige head. Hoppy aroma along with grapefruit, grass and pine. The flavour contains more roasted tones and coffee but theres still a hoppy touch in the end with grass and grapefruit. Slick mouth feel, and the bitterness is at a medium level. A hoppy and well balanced BIPA.

Very pleasant aroma of sweet mature fruit and caramel with toasted hints. Surely they used english hops (Northdown?) which are very strong and aromatic but not much citrusy (despite the manufacturers description). Intense black color with a beige foam that doesnt last long. Maybe bitterer than what its aroma imply. Its toasted notes take over the hoppy character making it seem more "stouty" than I wanted. Overall a good BIPA but I tasted better ones.
Svart farge med beige skum. Lukter humle og kaffe. Fyldig og smak av kaffe og noe fruktig. Bitter ettersmak som sitter i. Kjenner noe alkoholvarme.
Svart med rødskjær med lavt beige skum. Humle, kaffe og fruktig lukt. Smake fruktig og sjokolade. Mitterheten kommer sent men godt.

Bottle. Pours a near-black deep brown body with a small off-white head. Nose is pine, spruce, freshlty cut grass, hints of chocolate, peaches and cold coffee. Taste is pine, coffee, resin, grass, hints of peaches, herbs and licorice. Medium body and carbonation. A very well executed BIPA with a flavorful, hoppy profile while still having a bit to offer on the malty side.
bottle. Clash of roasted malts and citrus hops. Good clash. Taste is a balanced mixture of bitter and sweet. Pine, raisin, coffee. Very good one!

2014-07-04. Black body nice tan head and lace. 3+ Aroma is a melange of green hops dark malt and lightly roasty malt. Flavour is moderately bitter throughout, the hops and lightly roasty dark malts work well together and find a good balance. Relatively rich overall, the alcohol is restrained. Smooth average plus bodied palate, modest carbonation. Very nice stuff. Bottle from Alesela, Glasgow.
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a nice creamy head. Aroma of roasted Malt, hops and caramel. Light bitter, medium sweet with a soft dark fruit/roasted end. Late night. Steinkjer

Bottle from Hell Hunt, Tallinn. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy off white head and a little lace. The aroma is big grassy hop. The flavour is strong bitter with a huge grass nettle light spice pepper hop citrus palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. They teally threw the hops at this one and sometimes it works and other times it doesnt. This does however work for me. Id normally mark a beer down for being a little one dimesional, but this time I will make an exception.
33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours almost pitch black with a big foamy beige head. Mainly aromas of roasted coffee and citrus fruits. Long bitter aftertaste. Smooth and nice IPA.

14.07.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and fresh roasted, dark malts, pine needles, caramel, hops, coffee, bark, licorice, grass, leafs. Taste is dry and roasted, dark malts, coffee, pine needles, lots of hops, burnt caramel, bark, soil, weeds, grass, leafs, licorice. Longlasting bitterness, dry and a little thin mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation. Nice enough.

Bottle. It pours a big, creamy, dark beige head over an almost black body. Nice lacings. Roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and lots of orange peel and pine cones. Its full bodied and a bit heavy on the carbonation. Still nice though. Semi-dry. Roasted matls, dark chocolate, hints of coffee and lots of pine cones and citrus peel. Nice hoppy bitterness too, lasting for a good while. Roasted malts and hop flavors in the finish. Sure a nice one, although its a bit more dark malty than I prefer my Black IPAs. 140613

Bottle 330ml @ yngwie
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, pine and caramel. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long dry, citrus and grape fruity, piney and hint of chocolate in the finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Mørk i fargen med medium skum. Aroma av røstet malt og fruktig. Smaken er søtlig, med elementer av sjokolade og frukt, grapefrukt. Også blomster. Noe tørr, semibitter ettersmak.

Flaske 330ml fra Vinmomopolet Tromsø Langnes. Kullsvart. Høyt tett skum med litt farge. Varer. Kniplingslacing. Litt dempet fruktig aroma. Overmoden banan. Smaken frisk syrlig. På grensen til pepper. Avslutter tørt.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Sørlandssenteret. Bottled 24.03.14. Black with a lot of tan head. Malt, alcohol and red fruit nose. Above medium body. Below medium carbonation. Bitter. Some dryness. Burnst malt, hop, some plum and raisin flavour. A good beer.
Amazing black ipa. Smooth and slightly thick body of roasted malt. Taste of coffee, some rough licorice and of course fruity hops. Very good.
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has laods of hops pine and grass with sime chokolate and roastiness from the malt. Taste is roasty with a lot of hops a very nice bipa!

Bottle polet Vika, Oslo. Pours a nice head, doesnt last very long but stays at a minimum on the top. The aroma is really funky: old sweaty workout suit (on the sweet side), 1950s army style fitness hall, wet dog, nosebleeds, caramelized tampon and a certain hint of just regular caramel. Seriously, among four people we really did pick up all those things. The taste was free of any of the above mentioned, apart from the caramel, slightly roasted, heavy liquorice - the style you buy in small tin cans which has a very bitter taste. Pleasant hoppy finish. The beer was very nice on the taste buds, but would easily compete with some of the more rancid cheese on the market regarding smell. Would be interesting to try it again later to see if the aroma was a one off or not.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, june 20th 2014. Black body with a small tanned head. Aroma is roasted and hoppy, fresh citrusy hops, grapefruit, peach, pineapple. Taste of bitter black coffee with juicy hops, notably grapefruit and peach, with a soft vanilla touch at the finish, leaving a fruity sweet yet bitter aftertaste. An excellent beer, this is how I like my black ipas!
500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a hazy brown colour with medium tan head. Aroma is hoppy, roasted malt, tropical fruits. Taste is pretty much the same. Very good.

330 ml bottle from Birra + (Bottled on 23-04-2014). Very dark brown with some red tinges, but looking almost black in the glass, with a nice, creamy and persistent light beige head. Fruity, hoppy and slightly toasted nose, plent of citrus, light lemon peel, definitely pine needles, a hint of sticky caramel, some bubblegum too. Certainly more "black" in the mouth. Bitter dark chocolate, espresso coffee notes, roasted malts, while reamaining hoppy and resinous. Not the most bitter BIPA, in fact its actually on the sweet side. Some alchool warming as well. Soft to average carbonation, on the higher side of medium body, slightly oily texture. Very nice aroma, but the rest didnt follow suite. In some way unbalanced and a bit rough.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit einer wunderbar schönen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig fruchtig, röstmalzig, Kaffee. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, fruchtig, stark hopfig, bitter, Kaffee.
Not a bad one but also not relly hitting what I like. Thick, strong with some coffee and roasted malt. Classy classic.

Bottle from beersiveknown - many thanks, Steve! Pours out in a deep black colour with medium body and steady head. Aroma of fresh hops and roasted nuts. Taste of fresh hops, nuts, barley, spruce, oak and barrel. Fresh and citrus finish. Nice one.
330ml bottle from Alesela, Glasgow - opaque dark brown near black, thin tan head, strong grassy pine aroma, sweet, nicely balanced ale with plenty of hoppiness

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2014 Bottle shared with Mr_H fruity aroma with citrus notes flavour is similar flavour colour is dark almost Black tasty beer 
re rate on keg at hanging bat a really good example of a black ipa inital.svore.is fare possibly a 3.7 beer

Heres a biased rating (that luckily wont count) from a sucker for Black / Imperial IPA-s. Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja food department ( 3,90). Pours a super dark brown with a frothy, creamy and persistent head leaving islets on the glass wall. Aroma is truly intoxicating: fruity and floral hops (why wont they say which types?), slight touch of vanilla, vinegar and alcohol. Its something like a cocktail of ripe mango, pineapple, grapefruit and brown sugar with teaspoons of vanilla and green apple vodka (not that Ive had one) mixed by a master barman. As it warms, a more malty character comes to the fore. Strong fruity and alcoholic flavour with good bitterness. Full body, medium carbonation (that luckily almost disappears after a couple of minutes), soft and resinous mouthfeel with a slightly numbing effect on the tongue. Weirdly, I write this while listening to Black Sabbath, which I never do, but that seems to go well with the labels styling featuring what seem to be gargoyles. Id suggest sipping this mind-numbingly good but vicious and decadent beverage while watching a moronic classic, like the 1984 "Ghostbusters" or the 1992 "Batman Returns".

Black beer with a surprising lemony scent blended with hops. The flavour has the same elements but with a toasty malt edge to it as well. The aftertaste is quite dry with a touch of caramel in there with the malt. Very nice.

Pours black with a moderate beige head and good lacing. Aroma is a pleasant mix of roasted malts and citrus hops. Taste is a great citrus zest from the hops that is well balanced with the roasted malts. Great beer.
Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours black with a big,bubbly tan head. Aromas of pine, resin and roast. Taste has more chocolate notes, big hop bitterness. Bit fizzy, but very nice.

Bottled 06/02/14. Pours a dark reddy brown black with a tan head. Aroma has caramel, light veg, ripe trop fruit - pineapple. Medium body, medium carbonation. Some pine, grass, dark fruit, some light choccy stuff, bit of coffee and all the fruit - loads of fruit - grapefruit, orange, lemon, passion fruit, light lychee and theres a decent amount of caramel too. Solid.

Bottle: Poured a dark black color ale with a nice dark brown foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma consists of roasted malt with super nice notes of green hops with light piney notes. Taste is also dominated by deep roasted malt notes with some fresh green hops notes is really enjoyable. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Superb balance between green hoppy notes with some lightly roasted malt notes. I wish this beer was available locally on a regular basis.

Nareszcie takie Black IPA za jakim się stęskniłem :) Piana jest beżowa, pięknie oblepiająca teku. W aromacie chmiel, zioła, cytrusy z elementami szałwi. Smak wyraźnie żywiczny i sosnowy z idealną - średnią goryczką. Najważniejsze jest to, że piwo ani trochę nie jest palone czy kawowe - czuć chmiel i to lubię ;)

Bottle (330 ml). Dark brown with a medium beige head and heavy lacing. Aroma is a burst of chocolate with a fruit explosion along with resinous notes and liquorice. Taste is slightly sweet and moderately bitter with a huge amount of chocolate along pine, caramel and liquorice. Alcohol is well hidden Medium body. Lively carbonation. Dry finish. Drinkable for the abv and the style. Very tasty. Really good!

Pours a dark brown colour with copper highlights. The head is big, creamy, beige, has great retention and some tiny bubbled lacing. Nice fresh hoppy nose with the roasted malt as base. Much of the same for the taste. Oily mouthfeel with a nicely balanced bitterness creating some mild dryness in the finish, but not too much. The grass is fresh everywhere, so good choice of hops in this one. Goes down very well. Was just fooled by the title, as I did not expect an Imperial American Black Ale.

Aroma: flowers, citrus fruits, grapefruit?, notes of roasted malts. Appearance: black, medium creamy white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets expand, molasses, bread, cereal, light bitters at the very end. Overall: great Black IPA, very decent aroma and amazing palate. Pint at the Buxton Tap House, Buxton.

(bottle - mislabelled as strong ale - while it is very much a black IPA) clear very dark brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of citrus; mostly bitter flavour with a long light bitter finish; creamy palate

On bottle at Øltorget, Mathallen Oslo. Pitch black color, good offwhite foam / slightly brownish. Immediately hoppy, some roasted aromas, coffee, licorice: medium high aroma intensity. Medium: full body & high complexity . Solid bitterness - ok balance. Very enjoyable

Bottle in The Macc. Black with a nice pale tan head. Hmm. Dry smokey finish. Aroma has some nice piney hops, chocolate, malts. Flavour some creamy hops and chocolate, grapefruit. Good beer.

black, big tanned foam; hoppy (dark fruits, citrus) aroma with strong chocolate, roasty malty notes; medium bitterness, medium sweetness, very slightly sour; full body, oily thick feel, average carbonation, long bittersweet, dry finish;
Overall: great beer, complex, balanced, tasty

Cervesa amb una molt bona compenetració entre les maltes torrades i la gran quantitat de llúpol.
Cerveza con una buena compenetración entre las maltas tostadas y la gran cantidad de lúpulo.

Aroma: Mango, Lime, Grapefruit, Red Berries, hint of Chocolate.
Appearance: Black, minimal Tan Head.
Taste: Dark chocolate, coffee, grapefruit, citrus, roasty.
Palate: Light bodied, Oily texture, medium carbonation, warm, bitter roasty ending.
Overall: IPA with added Black. Leans more on the hoppy side than the malty, but retains a nice balance.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with big off-white head, nice lacing. Aroma is orange, citrus fruits, strawberries and light pine. Taste is medium sweet at the beginning. High, long and clead bitterness quickly takes over. Light roast. Medium body. Very good beer.

bottle, pours very dark brown, almost black with beige durable head. Intense citrus aroma with roasted bacground. Taste is very complex. Roasted malts, chocolate, a little bit of coffee, friuty, medium bitterness, bit sour. Medium body, nice bitter finish. Zajebiste :)
Flaska. Velmi, velmi tmave pivo. Vona prazene slady, kava, kakao, jemne alkohol. Chut opat prazene slady, horka cokolada, suchost kakaa.

Bottle. Aroma plum, chocolate. Light roast. Moderate herbal grassy hops. Dark brown colour. Taste is very nicely balanced, with bold amount of chocolate and roast complementing the grassy herbal hoppiness. Nicely balanced. Very good.

Bottle at Behind the hills beer tasting 2014. Pours black color, nice long lasting beige head. Aroma is roasted, hoppy, coffee, cocoa. Taste is roasted, hoppy, grapefruit, coffee, dark chocolate, lightly sweet, some hints of alcohol. Very nice one.
Bottle. Very dark brown color with medium beige heads. Roasted malt, citrus hops in aroma. Roasted malt, coffee, citrus hops in taste. Medium long hoppy bitter finish. Good.

My Bottom Line:
This fruity, resinous and chocolatey Black IPA pleases from aroma to finish, lending plenty of complexity and flavor.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A stable sheet of foam decorates the brown-edged black.
-Carbonation might be a bit zealous.
-Hop profile is more coniferous than citrusy.
-Bitterness is a blend of hop resins and malt roastiness.
-Drinkability is pretty high for the style.

Bottle. Merci, Ian!

500ml bottle. Pours jet black with frothy tan head, Could be visually mistaken for a porter until you smell the unmistakable hops. Then no doubt it is a black ipa.. Nose is citrus and grapefruit, Subtle malt, licorice and pine resin undertones lead to a lingering bitterness, Cheers.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks kerenmk. Pours brow to black, ugly, aroma of orange, tangerine, fresh, flavor is roasted and smoked with tangerine and some acidity tones, medium bodied

500ml bottle from LCBO. Pours very dark brown with a spongy tan head. Hoppy citrus aroma with some molasses, coffee malt. Medium, creamy body. A hint of floral. Balanced and smooth with a bitter finish. This is a great flavourful black IPA.

Expensive beer but worth the price. My bottle from an LCBO in toronto is estimated at a couple months old, but the hops hold on hard.

Upfront tropical fruity hops are what your first introduced to on the nose but a light woodyness and cocoa come through as well. 

This wonderful cherry note on the pallet that may be part of the stout or may be a combination of the hops and the stouts flavours but its a very none candied fresh cherry. 

I am a fan of big Beers and the quality of all aspects of this beer are apparent.

Get leather and over-roasted coffee on the finish. Which is a great contrast to the fruity hop character at the start. At one point I thought black ipas would be my favorite style before getting heavily into multiple belgian styles. This Beer is a great way to remind me of its styles potential.
Pours with a big beige head. Aroma is sweet fruit and hoppy. Taste of hops, citrus and burnt malts. Medium body with a flavor that lingers.

Cask Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2013, Parsons Green, London in July 2013 - Pitch Black in colour. Tan head. Very Malty; liquorice, roasty malts, coffee, caramel. Hoppy; distinct piney resiny hop bitterness. Fruity; grapefruit citrus and tropical fruits. Nice malt/hop/fruit balance. Terrific beer!

Very good imperial black ipa. First smell is balanced roasted malts and flowery goodness. The taste is very good in balance with the sweetness and the bitterness. Very well black ipa! Drink it :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Black colour, big, but not stable beige head. Strong aroma of grapefruit and mango, typical for IPA. Some roasted malts appears only in taste. Nice balance of maltiness (dark chocolate) and bitterness (grapefruit and lemon zest). Soft carbonation. Over medium body. Very good black IPA.

Botella de 33 cl en Cimmeria. Mayo de 2013. Black ipa contundente y con sabores y aromas destacados. Amargo seco y bastante notable al final combinado con maltas tostadas bastante bien. Bastante seca en general. Cuerpo intenso con 7.5 vol. bastante buenos y notables. Para repetir. Bastante buena.

This is a fantastic beer! Pours black with an initial big pillowy head and tons of lacing. Nose is fruity and nutty. Notes of fruit (pineapple, maybe some apricot, plum), coffee, roasted grain, maybe a hint of marshmallow. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Quite creamy mouth with medium carbonation. A really beauty!!

500ml bottle. Dark brown-ruby body, big mocha head with decent retention and good amount of lacing. Fresh aroma with a touch of sweetness: herbs, dust, wormwood, blackberry jam. Taste: bitter herbal hops upfront, followed by some burned toast, caramel, blackberry jam. A very nice surprise.

.33l bottle @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma is hops, dark even roasted malts, citrus fruits, salt liquorice. Flavor is burned malts, hops, coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate. Dry burned palate. Swell beer! Louis Balfour would say: Great...

Appearance: pitch black with a huge tan head that just wont drop. Great lacing.

Aroma: fresh, citrusy and hoppy. Exactly how a Black IPA should smell. Even though its black, theres no roastiness, no coffee, no chocolate in the aroma. Only fresh hops.

Taste: pretty much the same as the aroma: hoppy, citrusy, however there are some roasty notes in the background, very subtle though. Medium bitterness, perfect for this beer.

Mouthfeel: medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation.

Overall: a perfect example of how a black IPA should look, smell and taste like. This one is one of my all time favourite beers and I enjoy drinking it every once in a while. Highly recommended.

Enjoyed from a teku glass.

Fruity, spicy aroma. It smells green, and tastes the same. Small but stable head, lot of tropical fruit and hops. Long aftertaste with toned and balanced bitterness. My no.1 beer for half a year now. Still need to find something better :D

Draught @ Animal Bar. Pours dark brown with a moderate beige head. Aroma is hoppy, sweet, tropical fruity, light roasted malt. Flavor is quite the same, light sweet in the start fallowed by a moderate bitterness.
Very nice black IPA, I like it particularly because the roastiness is only in the background.

[Bottle (500ml)] Pours a very dark amber-brown with a large mostly-lasting rocky tan head and lots of lacing. Aroma has a surprising, in a good way, amount of hops along with malt and some coffee -- mostly just hops though. (Surprising because I didnt realize this was a Black IPA) Flavour is also really hoppy along with some roasted malt, coffee and a long moderate hoppy finish. Medium bodied. Really good, I need to get more.

500ml bottle. Black pour with a foamy tan head. Aroma is lemon, pine resin, grass and roasted malts. Taste is pine, citrus, licorice, roasted malts and smoke. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

(Draught at Man in the Moon, Stockholm, 20 Feb 2014) Black colour with frothy, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of pine needles, coffee, dark chocolate, black rye bread and hints of mint. Malty, roasted, hoppy taste with coffee, dark chocolate, pine needles, grapefruit, black rye bread and a generous piney, citric bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Very tasty and well made black IPA. Very nice.

Pours black as sin with a small mocha head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, tropical fruit, citrus, roasted malts. Taste is citrus, peach, apricot, roasted malts, honey, cocoa, slight vanilla. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy. Stellar stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from Świat Piwa, Cracow, Poland
Black brownish color with small tan head. Grapefruit and pine aroma, some coffee and malty notes. Medium mouthfeel, carbonation is soft. Taste of grapefruit and roasted malt. Great balance between bitterness and malt. Really nice black IPA.

Pours motor oil black with a foamy beige cap that leaves behind good lacing, sexy. The aroma is pine, peach, grapefruit, the dark malt presence rounds out the edges with an anise like note. The flavour follows suit exactly, finishes on a lingering mix of grapefruit and salted licorice, more grapefruit than licorice. Perhaps some of the juiciest grapefruit and peach notes Ive ever experience in a beer, and unexpectedly from a black ipa! More IPA than black in my opinion, but super enjoyable either way. Loved it.

Draught. A black beer, tan small head. Grapefruity and piney nose, some peach notes. A hint of bready roastedness. Dry, crisp maltiness, juicy fresh happiness, pine a touch of caramel. Intense, resiny bitter finish with dry, almost ashy roastedness, minor coffer notes. Medium body. Very good stuff.

The beer pours a solid blackish-brown colour with a thin creamy tan coloured head. Aroma is strong on the citrusy hops, with hints of roast and coffee. Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Flavour is citrus infused roasted malt with an excellent balance between the two. A very good Black IPA

500 mL bottle. For some reason, until I took a whiff of this beer, I assumed it was an IS. Musta been the word "Imperial" in there. Anyhow. It looks like an IS. Is smells and tastes like a lovely black IPA. This is a very well constructed beer. There is excellent balance of malt and hop flavours, and of sweetness and bitterness. Absolutely outstanding.

what a nice juicy grapefruit hop taste and plenty of it, while it doesnt become a palate destroyer. The dark malt secures the balance nicely in place with some sweet chocolate liqueur in the BG, if the appearance did not stylistically bias you this would occur as just a very good strong IPA with sone unusual & good fruit and malt undertones.
Big piney citrus aroma. Opaque, some light caramel malt, great balance between the malt and the hops.

Pours Jet black, with a small tan head. Aroma: notes of citrus, liquorice, tannins, coffee, and pine. The Palate is full bodied, with a lively carbonation, and slick mouth-feel. Taste: notes of citrus and pine bitterness, with a chocolate, and licorice malt notes. This beer finishes with a resinous bitterness. This is an outstanding Black IPA!

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours deep brown-black with a generous khaki head. Nose is big pine with vanilla and dark fruit notes. Taste is bitter citrus throughout with enough sweet chocolate and toffee to balance things. medium slick body with average carbonation and a nice lingering bitter finish. Excellent.

Flaske på Cardinal. Litt lite skum. Lukter malt og humle. Fin ettersmak. 
Anelse kaffe og sjokolade.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. BB Aug 2014.
App.: Brown-black with a full, light mocha head.
 
Aroma: Rich pine/resin and citrus peel, quite hoppy and vibrant, a touch bright/acidic, some roasted malt character, vaguely woody/smoky, maybe some caramel/treacle support.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, full, fine, elegant effervescence.
 
Flav.: A nice blend of potent hops and sufficient dark-roasted malt support, more malt than the nose with limited chocolate and coffee notes, pine/resin and citrus peel dominate, with a slightly tangy, vinous character as accent, quite a nice BIPA; dry with decent bitterness and a long, resinous, slightly roasted finish.

For me, this is an excellent Black IPA.

Deep pitch black pour with a thick moussey brown head. The aroma is amazing - orange peel, tangerine and some slightly tropical notes. A very subtle bit of cocoa and a touch of moderate malt character through the middle. Medium bodied but the hops in here are very expressive. Juicy and citrusy with a fantastic balance of malt and hops. Has a little bit of floral character as well. Its lovely.

500ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours a dark brown/black with a frothy, tan, three finger head that thins to one finger but stays forever. Aroma has big notes of tropical fruits, pine, resin, grapefruit, and faint chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is slightly on the bitter side. Starts out with a pine/resin/tropical fruit flavour then moves to a slightly chocolaty roast, and ends with a noticeable alcohol taste and warmth. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Slightly resiny mouth feel with a subtle carbonation. Overall a really nice imperial black IPA. Lots of hop flavours with a subtle roasted undertone. Would get again if I was in the mood for a strong flavoured Black IPA.

Some zesty citrus indeed. Finishes with a dose of it, mixed with bitter tinge from hops. Plenty of roast floating around as well.Pours black with good head and lacing. Thick texture. Light hint of sourness in finish as well. Bottle.

500ml bottle LCBO. Dark brew with an almost butterscotch like head. Hoppy aroma with a rather upfront citrus note and pungent hops. As it opens up a bit there sweeter roasted notes start to come through but mostly the aroma is hoppy, although some what quiet. On the palate it drinks like an IPA and the roasted notes only add to the bitterness. This is quite good!

500 mL bottle. Black that lets through just a little bit of light. Chunky yeast haze due to my neglect to pour slowly as the bottle suggests. Dank herbal notes, dark berry, deeply bitter citrus, coffee and roasty malt. Just bitter enough, balanced with a subtle malt sweetness. Moderate to full bodied with average plus carbonation. Very much up my alley, really, quite good.
January 31, 2014. 500mL bottle from LCBO. Lovely lacing. Pine and a bit of soap on the nose. Tan head. More balanced than expected based on the nose. Bitter aftertaste. Quite a nice Black IPA.

500ml bottle from the LCBO. dark brown, tan head. appropriate black IPA. in good shape considering the delay getting it into Ontario. lots of flavour, not the most drinkable. good if you like the style.
A very drinkable and balanced achievement. Bang on the style, jet black, citrus aroma, roast right there. Above average mouthfeel.LCBO.

Random purchase at LCBO turns into a winner. Pop the cap off & dig that crazy crushed citrus aroma, daddy-o. Pours blacker than a neo-cons conscience with a two finger tan cap. A pour joy to drink: popping hops, punchy palate, subtle notes of licorce & wet ganja, and ending with a throaty aftertaste. Word to the wise: if see one of these beauties on the shelf you should grab a fistful.

500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a very dark brown with good-sized, lasting tan head. Aroma is nicely balanced between roasty malt and citrusy and resiny hops. Flavour is roasty, almost ashy malt with some fruit and licorice and solid citric/piney hop presence. Lingering bitterness in finish. Very nice.
Bottle from lcbo. Fruit candy aroma. Black with a tan head. Roasty and licorice taste with c-hops and a bitter finish.
Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Murky dark brown. Coke and faint smoke aroma, delicate bitterness with just a little ash in the mouth. Medium-to-full body, a little ash finish.
Black pour with a good sized head. Pine and roast in the aroma, anise, citrus peels. Bitter up front, citrus, pine resin, roasted malt, a bit fruity. Medium body. Ill be buying a few more.
500 ml bottle. Brownish black beige head. Aroma hoppy, roasted, liquorice, pine, faint resin, soap and flowers. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, lots of hops, pine, citrus and resin. Nice and xresh
Black with a tan head. Hoppy, fruity, roasted malts/bread aroma. Oily, piney taste with citrus and roast notes. Good beer for cold winter evenings.

DWG; Pours black with fading tan head. Roasted malty, dark, tropic fruity, coffe aroma and taste. Medium body, light texture. Low carbonation. Lasting bitter, smoky finish.

At a tasting, thanks kerenmk, very dark brown colour, flavour of ash, wood, grapefruit and a hint of dark bread, fruity flavour with some smoked meat, strong characterfull bitterness. Very enjoyable and highly original.

33cl bottle from Õllepood Nr.1 Gambrinus, Tartu. Pours pretty much black with a tan head. Fresh hoppy aroma with pine, fruits, citrus and some dark and roasty notes in the background. Quite dominated by the hops, but well balanced and refreshing. Moderate sweet with delicous hoppy flavours and a quite bitter and citrusy finish. The black aromas seems to stay in the background and its more like a regular IPA, but certainly a nice one.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks troubles. Dark brown color. Pleasant aroma of fruity and piney hops and a bit of roastiness. Pretty bitter flavor with piney and fruity hops, some dark malt with some roastiness and a touch of chocolate. Medium-bodied. Nice.

330ml bottle. Very dark brown color. Massive size, brown head, stays. Full of hops, sweet, mellow roast, fresh notes in aroma. Nice sneaking roast, bunch of hops, juicy, floral taste. Well balanced bitterness. Nice brew!

Bottle. Deep dark brown body with a tall creamy head. Aroma mostly has fresh hops and not so much roast. Eyes closed, I would have thought its the smell of a regular IPA. Taste also has mainly citric hops, mild roast comes second. Alcohol is well integrated but the finish is slightly astringent.

Bow-tie black, foamy and filmy thin tan head. Shuffling lactic richness, bright hop and squeaky smokiness. Earthy Oaty initial taste but quickly overtaken by a neatly quenching bitterness. Open and ambitious malt thread is what does this beer justice in whatever age, dispense or how ruined my palate is. Dense but firm carbonation eases an oily rauch vibe, odd but exhilarating and adds to the dryness. Assuming oiliness to the finish, weird Tuna light smokiness and linger is oddly plum fruit and creamy. A fine beer and a finer example of Black IPA. Keg, Hanging Bat
Pours black with a large head. Aroma is lime, blackcurrant and pine. Subtle. Taste has pine throughout, some blackcurrant. Pine and roast lingers on the finish.

Bottle shared. Pours deep brown with a frothy brown head. Aroma is grass, caramel, coffee, roasted malts, some liquorice and chocolate. Taste is heavy bitter and light to moderate sweet. Nice! Medium to full body with soft carbonation. Lovely stuff.

Intense aroma of pine, fruits, raisins, hints of salt. Pours pitch black with beautiful big tan head. The head stays for a long time. Nice lacing also. Taste: raisins, coffee, roasted malts, piney, grapefruit. The bitterness gets more intense in the finish. No noticeable alcohol. Medium carbonation. Overall: really great looking and smelling beer.
Bottle. Dark amber color with a medium thick foamy head. Aroma of roasted malt, hops and lemon. Bitter taste with some sweetness. A bit oily feel.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Keg at Brewdog Shepards Bush opening night. Im not sure this is the beer I asked for but here goes. Aroma is roast and light tart earthy mushroom. Opaque black pour with a persistent light tan head. Flavour is mineral, smooth roast coffee and earthy hop. Light sour raspberry in the finish. Body is a touch light.

Bottled 500ml @Beer Hunters
Dark brown, almost opaque color, small steady beige head. Hoppy nose with hints of licorice. Medium-bodied. Sweetish malty backbone, fruity hoppyness and salty licorice. Quite sweet black IPA. American style, not British of course.

Botella de 330ml. Vaso de ½ pt. Saboreada en L´Espumossa (Barcelona). Color negro intenso con tintes ámbar muy oscuros a contraluz. Espuma color beige que crea una bonita, copiosa y persistente capa. Aromas intensos de chocolate, notes lupulizadas, cítricos y leve afrutado. La entrada es cremosa y torrefacta que precede a un amargor floral. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación moderada/suave. Textura viscosa en un paladar aterciopelado y picante. Toques de torrefacto y resinas permanecen en el prolongado y amargo final. Frutos oscuros en el retrogusto. Sin duda, una de las mejores American Black que nunca haya probado !!
330ml bottle. ½ pt glass. Enjoyed @ L´Espumossa (Barcelona). Pure black color & very dark amber tints to the light. Beige foam, nice, copious & lasting crown. Intense chocolate aroma, hoppy notes, citrics & slight fruity to the nose. Enters creamy & roasted then floral bitterness is felt. Medium to full body. Moderate to soft carbonation. Viscous texture. Velvet & spicy palate. Touches of coffee & resins in the middle linger into a long bitter finish. Dark fruits on the aftertaste. One of the best American Black I´ve ever tasted!!

Bottle with Sir__V @ his Home
Black opaque color, a thin ligh brown foam. No carbonization.
The smell is a lot of caramel flavor, roasted malt.
At first taste, you have a lot of roasted coffee taste in mouth.
After taste is hoppy that let you a nice wet bitterness

Bottle from Beer Parlour, Chesterfield, Derbyshire. Black, with a tan coloured, thin, tight, white head. A handsome beer. Aroma is the whole works. Roasted malt with a light smokiness. Big grapefruit hoppiness too. Its all a bit odd really, until you taste it and it all comes together. Very bitter, long roasty finish.

Tap at Mikkeller SF (a pleasant surprise!). Murky brown/black. Big piney hops on the nose, plenty of dank grapefruity stuff, and a touch of sweet chocolate and light roast coffee. Big juicy hop hit upon tasting: plenty of pine and citrus fruit. Slightly ashy dark maltiness, with coffee, chocolate and a touch of treacle coming in there. Big piney hop bitterness lingers. Excellent.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours near black with a thick tan head and a citrus and treacle aroma. There is a hearty chocolate malt flavor with dome dark molasses and a hefty dose of hop bitterness.
Intensiv hopfiger Antrunk, zu gleichem Maße aber auch malzig mit deutlichen Schokoladennoten. Wenig fruchtig, die starke Malzigkeit wird durch den Hopfen ergänzt. Intensiv, gut! 11/13/12/11/10/12

Bottle 0,5l Black color, against the light dark brown. Wonderfull creamy and huge, rocky foam. Aroma is just perfect!!!. So complex and so intensive. Masterpiece. Citrus, tropical fruits, pines, oranges, resins, in the background chocolate. Taste: amazing balance between bitterness and some sweetness. Here we have some citrus, pines, resins, oranges, tropical fruits, grapefruits, citrus pulp - perfectly mixed with dark chocolate, roasty malts. Very refreshing and addictive taste. Long warming finish, alcohol imperceptible. Medium body, creamy texture with low carbonation. Fabulous and Fantastic beer!!! One of the greatest that I ever tasted.
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, coffee, chocolate, fruit, citrus and hops. Taste is somewhat sweet and roasty leading to a roasty and bitter finish. Great stuff.
God duft av citrus og litt sjokolade. Lite skum, litt langs kant. Dyp sort farge. Fin smak av citrus frukter med en liten smak av sjokolade.

Flaska från Rosses i Torrades, Barcelona. Så här, just så här vill jag ha min BIPA. Tropiska frukter och lakrits i doften. Går att sitta länge och bara inandas. I smaken hittas citron, grape, soja, lakrits samt en nötig ton. Fyllig kropp, len smak. Riktigt, riktigt bra!

500 ml bottle conditioned, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.5%. Black colour, moderate tan head. Lovely aroma of citrussy hops, on a background of moderately roasted malts, hints of dark chocolate. The medium dry flavour has again citrussy hops, blended with distinct roasted malts, notes of strong coffee, dark bitter chocolate and resin. The contradictory "Black IPA" style is beginning to grow on me, and this one is a fine specimen.

Bottle at Gallows Bird, Espoo. Pours black with a little white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma has a combination of hops and malts, espresso-like elements and dark chocolate feature alongside with piny hoppiness. Taste is very similar with strong stouts, as it?s more malty than hoppy. Maltiness brings flavours like coffee, chocolate and licorice with some soy sauce to the fore with hoppy bitterness balancing in the finish. Palate is full and creamy with a smooth, low to average carbonation. I really enjoyed this: a rich, long and interesting taste.

Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff sep-13: definitivt friskere og mer sympatisk enn Hardknott Code Black (også en svart bleking). Syrlig og litt medisinal, men allikevel god medisin. Interessant blanding av sødme, syrlighet og mørk bitterhet. God fylde, men stilarten (som språklig er en selvmotsigelse, a contradiction of terms ville en engelskmann sagt) er foreløpig ingen favoritt hos meg.

Almost black with a creamy big head, leaves lacing. Aroma is fruity hops, peach, flowery, pine, caramel and a touch of roast. Medium full body, medium carbonation. Taste is roasted malts and fruity hops, coffee, caramel. Finish a bit short, but good anyways.

Tap at Maxs. Pours clear black with brown highlights, a medium frothy tan head, medium retention and good lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roast, and coffee malt, earthy and pine hops, prunes and raisins. Flavor is dark malt, moderate hops and bitterness, dark bitter/tart fruits and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

4oz pour at Maxs Hop Fest 2013. Pours a translucent, mahogany with some light lacing head. Nose is nice, piney, floral, cracker, bread crust. Flavor is malty, brown sugar, cracker, pine, lemon, soap. Astringent finish. Good example of the style.
On tap. Black colour with off-white head. Chocolate, grassy hops aroma. Roasted malts and chocolate taste, with grassy hops freshness. Bitter. Medium body.

bottle. black. initially a very,nice grapefruity citrus, fresh currants and gooseberries, hoppy bouquet, which actually lasts for a while. turns piny though, and roasty. full bodied, smooth. roasted malts, licorice. dark berries, violets. with the lingering fruity citrus in the finish. drinkable and nice. a bit too clean almost.-- bb/wp8

Very enjoyable. Suprising too. This was far less heavy than I imagined. Starts with a strong floral/grassy aroma, then the flavour is mildly grapefruit with some hint of peachy fruit, then a strong bitter streak, followed by a rounded biscuit ending. Powerful. Enjoyable.
Bottle 33 CL. Pours black with brown white head. Notes of citrus, roasty malts, slight coffee. Interesting beer.
Bottled. Pours dark brown in color with a bubbly tan head. Roasted, hoppy, light fruity, cats pee in aroma. Grassy bitter with roasted notes in taste. Bitter chocolate in finish.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. has a roasted malty hoppy weak licorice aroma. Roasted malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor with hints of caramel. Has a roasted malty chocolate hoppy bitter weak peachy finish.

50cl, as Buxton Imperial Black, new English brew Anno 2012, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, complex bitter brew, bitter/fruity and slightly roasted/spicy, balanced, hazy, small head, good brew, yet expensive

Tap at Pelt Trader. Pours a very murky dark brown with a medium creamy beige head that doesnt even dissipate. Nose shows loads of piney hops and tropical fruits with heavy grapefruit. Some would say its over the top hoppy but I enjoy it. Some heavy liquorice in the taste with grassy hops and a very smokey bacon driven note. Some orange comes through. The smoked malts are a little overwhelming for my liking. Solid stuff

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Some roasty, light citrus and spicy aromas. Pours black, with off-white head, vanishing, some lacing. Medium body, soft carbonation, thick texture. Taste is bitter, spicy, some hot, subtle fuity flavours, well balanced. Aftertaste is hot. Very enjoyable.

Achetée à Saveur Drink, très belle bière noire surmontée dune fine mousse blanche. Le nez est très houblonné avec de superbe notes dagrumes (citron, pamplemousse...). En bouche, belles saveurs houblonnées dagrumes, fin de bouche sèche et amère. Une superbe black IPA.
Bottle 0.5l at Black Door, Helsinki. Originally rated 25082012. Colour is black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, hops and roasted malts. Fabulous.

Draught. Low fluffy and quickly disappearing brown head. Very dark body. Mild sugary coffee citrus cream aroma and flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Short finish. Alcohol level nicely disquised.

200ml, keg, shared with Skinnyviking at Mikkeller & Friends. Good lacing from a bubbly, tan-coloured head. Devil-black body colour. Aroma of earthy malts and dark fruits. Well blended taste of resin-like hops, coffee grounds, and dark fruits. Bitter finish. Fresh and nice (Copenhagen, 22.05.2013).
@Voldby. Dark brown coloured. Has an off-white head, lasting. Heavy hoppy aroma, herbs, citrus, fresh water. Sweet flavor, more hops, bitter finish. Dry-dry texture.
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 Carbonation refreshing. Sharp but coffee like other porters. Still refreshing like an IPA is.

Bottle. Black beer with off white medium head. Aroma is very hoppy and pine. Taste is hops, pine, roasted malts, coffee, citrus and a touch of bitter chocolate. Medium to full bodied with light carbonation. A very nice black IPA. I do prefer the Buxton Black Rocks slightly more though.
